subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 6, 2007

TOP STORIESTop Diabetes Doc Says Glaxo Threatened Him
The president-elect of the diabetes association will tell Congress today that GlaxoSmithKline threatened him with legal action
                        in 1999 when he first raised questions about Avandia. Glaxo is citing its own study to show that the drug is safe. More...Watch: Dr. Senay On Avandia    
• Congress Wants Answers On TB Scare• GOP Debate Forecasts Stormy Days Ahead
                     					| Watch• Man Tries To Jump Into Popemobile
                     					| WatchU.S.Video May Have Clues In Missing Teen Case
A young, goateed man videotaped leaving a store in Kansas moments before the apparent abduction of 18-year-old Kelsey Smith
                        is being sought for questioning, police said. The man hasn't been identified and is not being called a suspect. More...Watch: New Clue In Kelsey Smith Case
• Congress Wants Answers On TB Scare• Divorce American Style: Wife Gets $184M• Property Row Over Flight 93 Memorial Site• More StoriesWorldMan Tries To Jump Into Popemobile
A man tried to jump into Pope Benedict XVI's uncovered popemobile in St. Peter's Square and held onto it for a few seconds
                        before being wrestled to the ground by officers. The pope wasn't hurt and didn't even appear to notice the interruption.  More...Watch: Man Ambushes Popemobile
• Bush: "Russia Is Not An Enemy"
                     					| Watch• Frail But Alert Castro Appears On Cuban TV
                     					| Watch• Spain To Seize U.S. Treasure Hunter Ships• More StoriesPoliticsGOP Debate Forecasts Stormy Days Ahead
Divisions on issues from immigration to abortion were clear at the GOP presidential debate. After treading softly around an
                        unpopular president, wide cracks emerged between Mr. Bush and those seeking to replace him, reports Vaughn Ververs. More...Watch: Republican Debate
• Pardon Me?

                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthCongress Wants Answers On TB Scare
Senate and House committees were asking why a guard let Andrew Speaker cross the U.S.-Canada border, even though he was on
                        a list to be stopped, and why various federal agencies didn't communicate better with each other.  More...
• Body, Heal Thyself
                     					| Watch• Kevorkian's New Mission: Education
                     					| Watch• Can Aspirin Help Fight Cancer?• More StoriesSciTechNASA Head Sorry For Global Warming Doubts
The head of NASA told scientists and engineers that he regrets airing his personal views about global warming during a recent
                        radio interview, according to a video of the meeting obtained by The Associated Press. More...
• Mass Evacuations As Cyclone Gonu Hits Oman• Vatican Going Solar• Drought Exposes Finds On Fla. Lake Bottom• More StoriesBusinessSirius, XM, Hire High-Profile Lobbyists
The nation's only two satellite radio companies have hired a high-profile public affairs firm to lobby the federal government
                        on their proposed merger, which faces regulatory and congressional scrutiny. More...
• Billionaire Burkle May Bid For Dow Jones• A Win For Accidentally Aired Expletives• U.S. Auto Slump Moves Beyond The Big Three• More StoriesEntertainmentParis Hilton "Crying" Behind Bars
Defense lawyer Richard Hutton and Dr. Charles Sophy were visitors at the facility for two hours, the paper said, as the hotel
                        heiress seems to be struggling behind bars. More...
• Aniston Dating Model For Several Weeks• "Jericho" Might Make Midseason Return• Judge Orders Sizemore Held Without Bail• More StoriesOpinionHarry Potter & The Continuous Exploitation
If a Harry Potter theme park is a success, says special contributor Lloyd Garver, then others based on popular books
                        and movies are certain, although he hopes there won't be a theme park for the movie "Knocked Up." More...
• No Mercy For Libby• Hedge Hogs
                     					| Watch• GOP Must Focus On The Family
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Caught In The Web: Beware Of Internet Puppy Scam 
If you've gotten an e-mail offering pedigreed puppies at a fire sale price, join the club. It's the latest Internet scam.
                        Not surprisingly, there aren't really any puppies for sale and the AKC and the Better Business Bureau have put out a warning. More...
